summary: This document is a presentation outline from the Epstein investigation dated August 14, 2019, detailing the timeline of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It covers his psychological history, housing assignments, the falsification of count documents, and the circumstances of his suicide on August 9-10, 2019. It also outlines next steps and potential charges.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure of the investigation, detailing his arrest, psychological assessments, housing in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), and his suicide while incarcerated at MCC.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: An inmate housed with Jeffrey Epstein in the SHU at MCC from July 10, 2019, until an unspecified date.

persons.name: Reyes
persons.context: An inmate housed with Jeffrey Epstein in the SHU at MCC after Tartaglione; he left for court on the morning of August 9, 2019.

connections.description: Housed together in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC starting July 10, 2019.
Housed together in the SHU at MCC after Tartaglione; Reyes was his cellmate on the day of Epstein's suicide.

events.title: Epstein Arrested and Housed at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and initially housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: Intake Screening and Psych Observation
events.description: Epstein underwent intake screening and psychological observation at MCC.

events.title: Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: A suicide risk assessment was conducted on Epstein at MCC.

events.title: Epstein Housed in SHU with Tartaglione
events.description: Epstein was placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and housed with inmate Tartaglione.

events.title: July 23 Incident
events.description: An unspecified incident involving Epstein occurred at MCC (details not provided in outline).

events.title: Reyes Leaves for Court; Staffing and Document Falsification
events.description: Inmate Reyes left for court at 8 AM. The document notes at least 9 officers and 3 supervisors were on duty who should have known about events, and that count documents were falsified.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:33 AM during breakfast rounds. Resuscitation attempts failed, and he was pronounced dead at the hospital at 7:26 AM.

keyFacts: The investigation presentation outlines a detailed timeline of Jeffrey Epstein's psychological monitoring and housing changes within the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) from his arrest on July 6, 2019, to his death on August 10, 2019.
The document alleges falsification of official 'count documents' related to inmate checks, specifically asserting a belief that the 12 AM count on a key date was performed despite irregularities.

On August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein's death, his cellmate Reyes left for court, and the presentation notes at least 9 officers and 3 supervisors on duty 'should have known' about relevant circumstances, indicating they are subjects of subpoenas.
Epstein was found in his cell at approximately 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019, and was declared dead at a hospital at 7:26 AM after failed resuscitation attempts.

The presentation was structured to cover facts learned, next steps in the investigation, and potential charges and targets, indicating an active criminal investigation into the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.
